meta.job_title: Licensed Childcare Center Preschool Lead Teacher

duties_responsibilities.duty: Collaborate with the preschool team to create and implement a developmentally appropriate high-quality preschool program by ensuring best practices and regulatory standards are being met.
Lead and manage daily curriculum activities with a classroom of children ages 3-5 years old.
Complete incident/accident reports and support childcare center leadership staff on Department of Children, Youth, and Families (DCYF) compliance reports and DEEL reporting, if needed.
Ensure a ratio of 1:8 (staff to children) is maintained as much as possible to ensure that children are safe and accounted for.
Establish, strengthen, and maintain positive relationships with families, participants, and ARC/SPR staff.
Demonstrate/model the mission, vision, and values of ARC as an employee.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s Degree in Early Childhood Education (ECE), Early Childhood and Family Studies, or related degree OR Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college verified as “approved” in MERIT AND 30+ approved quarter credits in ECE, verified through MERIT. Up to 10 credits may be classified as ECE-School Age hybrid (“E/S”) credits.
